statements.statement: The staff I would be working with is about the same age as me.
The staff I would be working with shares the same faith / religion as me.
The staff I would be working with is female.
The staff I would be working with is the same sexual orientation as me.
The staff I would be working with earns about the same income as me (same income level)
The staff I would be working with used to be a domestic worker.
The staff I would be working with lives in the same community as me.
The staff I would be working with is from the same hometown as me.
The staff I would be working with has the same level of education as me.
The staff I would be working with has children.
The staff I would be working with has personal experience with mental health issues.
Other people about my age seek out services from this nonprofit.
Other people that share the same faith / religion as me seek out services from this nonprofit.
Other women seek out services from this nonprofit.
Other people seeking out services from this nonprofit are the same sexual orientation as me.
Other people seeking out services from this nonprofit earn about the same income as me.
Other domestic workers seek out services from this nonprofit.
Other people living in my community seek out services from this nonprofit.
Other people from my hometown (or home country) seek out services from this nonprofit.
Other people with a similar education as me seek out services from this nonprofit.
Other people with children seek out services from this nonprofit.
When I walk into the office, I feel safe.
I can visit the office without other people outside knowing my purpose.
I do not have to provide personal information to staff if I do not want to.
I can communicate with staff by telephone or internet (e.g., Zalo, Messenger, WhatsApp.)
I can communicate with staff face-to-face.
I can share personal information, thoughts, or concerns with staff without other people (staff or visitors) listening to our conversation.
The office (reception, meeting rooms) feels warm and welcoming.
The office is clean and tidy.
The office is peaceful (not too noisy).
The furniture and seating are comfortable.
The office is located in a safe environment.
The organization has a license to operate in Vietnam.
My family supports me seeking services from this organization.
My friends/peers support me seeking services from this organization.
The organization can provide examples of its impact.
The leader of this organization is a respected community member.
Staff have received mental health care education and training.
The staff have provided mental health care services for many years.
Staff understand my questions and concerns.
Staff show that they care about my health and well-being.
When I walk into the organization, I am welcomed by a staff person.
When talking with staff, I am treated with kindness and dignity.
Staff make time for my questions and concerns.
The process and criteria for accessing services from this nonprofit is clearly explained.
I do not have to wait a long time before meeting with a staff person.
Before providing personal information, staff share how they would use my information.
This organization provides me with the same quality of service as everyone else.
I am given a choice of services and service deliver options (I can choose the timeline, staff person to work with, etc.).
